meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of hagiography.
meanings.sent1: The book contained a hagiographic account of the saint's life.
meanings.sent2: The hagiographic painting depicted the hero in a glowing light.
meanings.sent3: The hagiographic film made the historical figure seem like a perfect angel.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was so hagiographic that it almost seemed like a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The hagiographic description of the event made it seem almost magical.

meanings.sent1: The article was hagiographic in its praise of the celebrity.
meanings.sent2: She received a hagiographic review for her performance in the play.
meanings.sent3: The hagiographic comments made everyone laugh at the exaggeration.
meanings.sent4: His hagiographic words painted a picture of perfection that was hard to believe.
meanings.sent5: The hagiographic portrait made the subject look like a flawless deity.
